title: Build macOS target and fix compilation errors
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/macos-desktop-app.md (Section: Verification)

## Context
After all platform conditionals are in place, the macOS target should compile. This task is for building and fixing any remaining compilation errors.

## Requirements
1. Build VoiceCodeMac target
2. Fix any compilation errors
3. Address critical warnings
4. Ensure app launches

## Technical Approach

### Process
1. Run `make build-mac` (or equivalent Makefile target)
2. Collect all error messages
3. Fix errors one by one, updating relevant tasks if needed
4. Iterate until build succeeds

### Common Issues to Expect
- Missing platform conditionals
- Unavailable APIs on macOS
- Import statement issues
- Type mismatches between platforms

### Dependencies
- Depends on ALL previous tasks (yfz.2 through yfz.9)
- This is the integration verification step

## Verification
1. `make build-mac` succeeds
2. No compilation errors
3. App binary is produced
4. App launches and shows main window

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] macOS target builds successfully
- [ ] No compilation errors
- [ ] App launches on macOS
- [ ] Main window displays

title: Run VoiceCodeMacTests
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/macos-desktop-app.md (Section: Verification)

## Context
Run automated tests against the macOS target to verify functionality. Tests should pass with the platform conditionals in place.

## Requirements
1. Run VoiceCodeMacTests target
2. Fix any failing tests
3. Ensure test coverage matches iOS

## Technical Approach

### Process
1. Run `make test-mac` (or equivalent Makefile target)
2. Review test results
3. Fix failing tests - may need platform conditionals in test code
4. Ensure excluded iOS-only tests are not run

### Excluded Tests (iOS-only, per design document)
- `DeviceAudioSessionManagerTests.swift` — tests AVAudioSession (iOS-only API)
- `VoiceOutputManagerTests.swift` — tests audio session configuration
- `CopyFeaturesTests.swift` — tests UIPasteboard clipboard operations
- `SessionInfoViewTests.swift` — tests UIPasteboard clipboard operations
- `QRScannerViewTests.swift` — tests QRScannerView (iOS-only, excluded from macOS target)

### Dependencies
- Depends on: voice-code-desktop3-yfz.10 (Build must succeed first)

## Verification
1. Test suite runs to completion
2. All tests pass
3. No unexpected test failures

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] VoiceCodeMacTests target runs
- [ ] All tests pass
- [ ] iOS-only tests properly excluded (5 files listed above)

title: Manual feature testing
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/macos-desktop-app.md (Section: Acceptance Criteria)

## Context
Final verification that all iOS features work correctly on macOS. Manual testing ensures parity beyond what automated tests cover.

## Requirements
Test all features from the acceptance criteria:
1. WebSocket connection to backend
2. Create/switch/delete sessions
3. Voice input recording
4. Send prompts, receive responses
5. Copy message to clipboard
6. Execute Makefile commands
7. View command history
8. View command output
9. API key authentication (manual entry)

## Technical Approach

### Test Script
1. Launch macOS app (without API key configured)
2. Verify authentication required screen appears
3. Enter API key manually in Settings
4. Verify backend connection (status indicator)
5. Create new session
6. Record voice input
7. Send text prompt
8. Receive response
9. Copy response to clipboard
10. Open Commands tab
11. Execute a command
12. View command history
13. Check command output
14. Switch sessions
15. Delete a session
16. Delete API key and verify disconnect

### Known Limitations (Expected)
- Resources feature may not work (no Share Extension on macOS in MVP)
- Haptic feedback not present (correct behavior)
- QR code scanning not available (iOS-only, manual entry works)

### Dependencies
- Depends on: voice-code-desktop3-yfz.11 (Tests must pass first)

## Verification
All acceptance criteria from the epic are manually verified.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Authentication required view shows when no API key
- [ ] API key can be entered manually in Settings
- [ ] App connects to WebSocket backend after authentication
- [ ] Sessions can be created, switched, deleted
- [ ] Voice input works
- [ ] Prompts sent successfully
- [ ] Responses received and displayed
- [ ] Clipboard copy works
- [ ] Commands execute
- [ ] Command history displays
- [ ] Command output viewable
- [ ] Resources displays (content may be empty without Share Extension)
- [ ] API key can be deleted from Settings

title: APIKeySection.swift platform conditionals for QR scanner
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/macos-desktop-app.md

## Context
The security feature added `APIKeySection.swift` which uses `QRScannerView` for camera-based QR code scanning. Since `QRScannerView.swift` is excluded from the macOS target (uses UIViewController and AVCaptureSession), `APIKeySection.swift` needs platform conditionals to hide QR scanning UI on macOS.

## Requirements
1. Add #if os(iOS) conditionals around QRScannerView usage
2. Hide "Scan QR Code" button on macOS
3. Hide "Update Key" button (which opens scanner) on macOS
4. Manual key entry remains the only option on macOS

## Technical Approach

### Files to Modify
- `ios/VoiceCode/Views/APIKeySection.swift`

### Changes
```swift
// Hide scanner sheet on macOS
#if os(iOS)
.sheet(isPresented: $showingScanner) {
    QRScannerView(...)
}
#endif

// In notConfiguredKeyView, hide scan button on macOS
#if os(iOS)
Button(action: { showingScanner = true }) {
    HStack {
        Text("Scan QR Code")
        ...
    }
}
#endif

// In configuredKeyView, hide update button on macOS
#if os(iOS)
Button(action: { showingScanner = true }) {
    HStack {
        Text("Update Key")
        ...
    }
}
#endif
```

### Dependencies
- Depends on: voice-code-desktop3-yfz.2 (QRScannerView must be excluded first)
- Can run in parallel with: yfz.3-9

## Verification
1. macOS target compiles without QRScannerView references
2. iOS target still shows QR scanning options
3. macOS shows only manual key entry
4. Key management (save/delete) works on both platforms

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No QRScannerView usage without #if os(iOS) guard
- [ ] macOS shows manual entry only (no scan buttons)
- [ ] iOS retains full QR scanning functionality
- [ ] Both platforms compile

title: Project Infrastructure: VoiceCodeMac target setup
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/macos-desktop-app.md

## Context
This is the foundation task that establishes the macOS target in the Xcode project. All other tasks depend on this being completed first. Without this infrastructure, there is no macOS build to modify or test.

## Requirements
1. Create VoiceCodeMac directory structure
2. Create macOS-specific Info.plist with required keys
3. Create macOS entitlements file with App Sandbox and network permissions
4. Update project.yml with VoiceCodeMac target configuration
5. Generate Xcode project and verify it opens without errors

## Technical Approach

### New Files
- `ios/VoiceCodeMac/Info.plist` - macOS app metadata (bundle ID, version, SwiftUI lifecycle)
- `ios/VoiceCodeMac/VoiceCodeMac.entitlements` - App Sandbox, network client, audio input

### Files to Modify
- `ios/project.yml` - Add VoiceCodeMac target with:
  - Platform: macOS
  - Deployment target: 15.0 (per design document line 388)
  - Sources pointing to shared VoiceCode/ and VoiceCodeMac/
  - Excludes for iOS-only files:
    - `Managers/DeviceAudioSessionManager.swift` (AVAudioSession)
    - `Views/QRScannerView.swift` (UIViewController, AVCaptureSession camera)
  - Test target VoiceCodeMacTests excluding iOS-only tests:
    - `DeviceAudioSessionManagerTests.swift`
    - `VoiceOutputManagerTests.swift`
    - `CopyFeaturesTests.swift`
    - `SessionInfoViewTests.swift`
    - `QRScannerViewTests.swift`

### Dependencies
None - this is the foundation task.

## Verification
1. Run `make generate` successfully
2. Open VoiceCode.xcodeproj in Xcode
3. Select VoiceCodeMac scheme
4. Build succeeds (may have warnings, but no errors blocking compilation)
5. App launches and shows main window

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] VoiceCodeMac/ directory exists with Info.plist and entitlements
- [ ] project.yml includes VoiceCodeMac and VoiceCodeMacTests targets
- [ ] project.yml excludes DeviceAudioSessionManager.swift and QRScannerView.swift from macOS
- [ ] VoiceCodeMacTests excludes 5 iOS-only test files
- [ ] macOS deployment target is 15.0
- [ ] `make generate` completes without errors
- [ ] Xcode opens project and shows both iOS and macOS schemes
- [ ] macOS target builds (compilation succeeds)

title: Create ClipboardUtility.swift
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/macos-desktop-app.md (Section: ClipboardUtility.swift, lines 317-352)

## Context
Centralizes clipboard and haptic feedback operations to avoid duplicating platform conditionals across 7 view files. This utility provides a single location for platform-specific code.

## Requirements
1. Create ClipboardUtility.swift with cross-platform clipboard copy function
2. Include haptic feedback wrapper (iOS-only, no-op on macOS)
3. Use proper platform conditionals (#if os(iOS) / #elseif os(macOS))

## Technical Approach

### New Files
- `ios/VoiceCode/Utils/ClipboardUtility.swift`

### Implementation (per design document)
```swift
import Foundation
#if os(iOS)
import UIKit
#elseif os(macOS)
import AppKit
#endif

enum ClipboardUtility {
    /// Copy text to system clipboard with optional haptic feedback (iOS only)
    static func copy(_ text: String) {
        #if os(iOS)
        UIPasteboard.general.string = text
        #elseif os(macOS)
        NSPasteboard.general.clearContents()
        NSPasteboard.general.setString(text, forType: .string)
        #endif
    }

    /// Trigger success haptic feedback (iOS only, no-op on macOS)
    static func triggerSuccessHaptic() {
        #if os(iOS)
        let generator = UINotificationFeedbackGenerator()
        generator.notificationOccurred(.success)
        #endif
        // macOS: No haptic feedback available
    }
}
```

### Dependencies
- Depends on: voice-code-desktop3-yfz.2 (Project Infrastructure)
- Can run in parallel with: yfz.4, yfz.5, yfz.6, yfz.7 (manager conditionals)

## Verification
1. File compiles for both iOS and macOS targets
2. No compiler errors or warnings about platform availability

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ClipboardUtility.swift exists in ios/VoiceCode/Utils/
- [ ] Has copy() and triggerSuccessHaptic() methods
- [ ] Compiles for iOS target
- [ ] Compiles for macOS target
- [ ] Platform conditionals are correct

title: VoiceCodeClient.swift platform conditionals
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/macos-desktop-app.md (Section: VoiceCodeClient.swift)

## Context
VoiceCodeClient uses UIApplication lifecycle notifications for WebSocket reconnection. macOS uses NSApplication equivalents.

## Requirements
1. Add platform conditionals for lifecycle notification observers
2. Use willEnterForegroundNotification (iOS) vs willBecomeActiveNotification (macOS)
3. Use didEnterBackgroundNotification (iOS) vs willResignActiveNotification (macOS)

## Technical Approach

### Files to Modify
- `ios/VoiceCode/Managers/VoiceCodeClient.swift`

### Changes
Replace UIApplication notification observers with platform-conditional versions:

```swift
#if os(iOS)
NotificationCenter.default.addObserver(
    self,
    selector: #selector(appWillEnterForeground),
    name: UIApplication.willEnterForegroundNotification,
    object: nil
)
#elseif os(macOS)
NotificationCenter.default.addObserver(
    self,
    selector: #selector(appWillEnterForeground),
    name: NSApplication.willBecomeActiveNotification,
    object: nil
)
#endif
```

### Dependencies
- Depends on: voice-code-desktop3-yfz.2 (Project Infrastructure)
- Can run in parallel with: yfz.3, yfz.5, yfz.6, yfz.7

## Verification
1. macOS target compiles without UIApplication errors
2. iOS target still compiles correctly
3. WebSocket reconnects properly on both platforms

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No UIApplication references without #if os(iOS) guard
- [ ] macOS uses NSApplication equivalents
- [ ] Compiles for both platforms

title: VoiceInputManager.swift platform conditionals
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/macos-desktop-app.md (Section: VoiceInputManager.swift)

## Context
VoiceInputManager uses AVAudioSession for iOS audio configuration. macOS does not have AVAudioSession - it uses AVAudioEngine directly without session management.

## Requirements
1. Guard all AVAudioSession calls with #if os(iOS)
2. macOS audio input works without session configuration
3. Preserve iOS behavior exactly

## Technical Approach

### Files to Modify
- `ios/VoiceCode/Managers/VoiceInputManager.swift`

### Changes
Wrap AVAudioSession configuration in platform conditionals:

```swift
private func configureAudioSession() throws {
    #if os(iOS)
    let session = AVAudioSession.sharedInstance()
    try session.setCategory(.playAndRecord, mode: .default, options: [.defaultToSpeaker, .allowBluetooth])
    try session.setActive(true)
    #endif
    // macOS: No session configuration needed
}
```

### Dependencies
- Depends on: voice-code-desktop3-yfz.2 (Project Infrastructure)
- Can run in parallel with: yfz.3, yfz.4, yfz.6, yfz.7

## Verification
1. macOS target compiles without AVAudioSession errors
2. Voice input works on macOS using AVAudioEngine
3. iOS behavior unchanged

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No AVAudioSession references without #if os(iOS) guard
- [ ] macOS compiles successfully
- [ ] Voice recording starts without errors on macOS

title: VoiceOutputManager.swift platform conditionals
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/macos-desktop-app.md (Section: VoiceOutputManager.swift)

## Context
VoiceOutputManager has AVAudioSession guards for audio playback. The interruptionHandler property and session configuration need platform conditionals.

## Requirements
1. Guard AVAudioSession usage with #if os(iOS)
2. Remove or conditionally compile interruptionHandler property
3. Ensure audio playback works on macOS

## Technical Approach

### Files to Modify
- `ios/VoiceCode/Managers/VoiceOutputManager.swift`

### Changes
```swift
#if os(iOS)
private var interruptionHandler: Any?
#endif

private func setupAudioSession() {
    #if os(iOS)
    let session = AVAudioSession.sharedInstance()
    try? session.setCategory(.playback, mode: .default)
    try? session.setActive(true)
    #endif
}
```

title: VoiceCodeApp.swift platform conditionals
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/macos-desktop-app.md (Section: VoiceCodeApp.swift)

## Context
VoiceCodeApp uses UIApplication lifecycle hooks for app state management. macOS uses NSApplication equivalents with different lifecycle methods.

## Requirements
1. Add platform conditionals for scenePhase handling
2. Replace UIApplication-specific code with NSApplication equivalents
3. Maintain same behavior on both platforms

## Technical Approach

### Files to Modify
- `ios/VoiceCode/VoiceCodeApp.swift`

### Changes
```swift
.onChange(of: scenePhase) { newPhase in
    switch newPhase {
    case .active:
        voiceCodeClient.connect()
    case .background:
        #if os(iOS)
        voiceCodeClient.disconnect()
        #endif
        // macOS: Keep connection alive
    case .inactive:
        break
    @unknown default:
        break
    }
}
```

### Dependencies
- Depends on: voice-code-desktop3-yfz.2 (Project Infrastructure)
- Can run in parallel with: yfz.3, yfz.4, yfz.5, yfz.6

## Verification
1. App launches correctly on macOS
2. WebSocket connects on app activation
3. iOS behavior unchanged

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No UIApplication references without guards
- [ ] App launches on macOS
- [ ] Lifecycle behavior appropriate for each platform

title: Implement auth namespace with key generation and validation
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/api-key-authentication.md#3-detailed-design

## Context

## Requirements
- [ ] Create backend/src/voice_code/auth.clj namespace
- [ ] Implement generate-key using SecureRandom for 128-bit entropy
- [ ] Implement valid-key-format? to validate 43-char key structure
- [ ] Implement constant-time-equals? to prevent timing attacks
- [ ] Implement save-key! with chmod 600 file permissions
- [ ] Implement load-key with nil return for missing file
- [ ] Implement authenticate combining load and compare
- [ ] Use dynamic var *key-file-path* for test isolation

## Technical Approach
- Files to create: backend/src/voice_code/auth.clj
- Key format: 11-char prefix + 32 lowercase hex chars = 43 chars total
- Key file location: ~/.voice-code/api-key
- Use java.security.SecureRandom for entropy
- Use byte-level XOR accumulation for constant-time comparison

## Verification

- [ ] Unit test: valid-key-format? accepts valid, rejects invalid formats
- [ ] Unit test: constant-time-equals? returns correct results

## Design Document
@docs/api-key-authentication.md

## Overview
Implement Pre-Shared Key (PSK) authentication between iOS app and Clojure backend. Users generate a 43-character API key on the backend, scan it via QR code on iOS, and all subsequent WebSocket and HTTP connections are authenticated.

## Acceptance Criteria
1. Backend generates cryptographically secure 43-char API keys (voice-code- prefix + 32 hex chars)
2. Backend displays API key as QR code in terminal with Unicode block characters
3. iOS app scans QR code and stores key securely in Keychain with Share Extension access
4. WebSocket connections include api_key in connect message; backend validates and marks channel authenticated
5. Invalid/missing API keys are rejected with generic auth_error message (timing-attack resistant)
6. Authentication persists for WebSocket session lifetime (no per-message auth)
7. HTTP endpoints validate Bearer token in Authorization header
8. Share Extension includes API key in HTTP requests
9. iOS provides UI for key management (scan, view, delete)
10. Clear error UX when authentication fails or key is missing
